verses.text: 你們總要保持弟兄的愛。

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to fellow believers.

verses.text: 不要忘了用愛心接待人，有人就是這樣作，在無意中就款待了天使。

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 你們要記念那些被囚禁的人，好像跟他們一起被囚禁；也要記念那些受虐待的人，好像你們也親自受過。

words.note: Often implies active remembering or commemorating in a religious sense.

verses.text: 人人都應該尊重婚姻，婚床也不要玷污，因為 神一定審判淫亂的和姦淫的人。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for moral impurity.
The preceding space/square is a reverential convention in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to both the act of judging and the verdict itself.
Pertains to sexual immorality, including fornication.
Specifically refers to illicit sexual relations involving a married person.

verses.text: 你們為人不要貪愛錢財，要以現在所有的為滿足；因為 神親自說過：「我決不撇下你，也不離棄你。」

words.note: The preceding space/square is a reverential convention in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 所以我們可以放膽說：「主是我的幫助，我決不害怕，人能把我怎麼樣呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'release one's courage'.
A respectful title for God or Christ.
Marks the direct object before the verb.
Used at the end of a question.

verses.text: 你們要記念那些領導過你們，把 神的道傳給你們的人；你們要觀察他們一生的成果，要效法他們的信心。

words.note: Indicates a past experience.
Marks the direct object before the verb.
Refers to the Christian God.
In a biblical context, often refers to God's Word/message.

words.definition: to pass on to, preach to

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a noun clause.
Often used for imitating a good example.
Can mean general confidence, but in religious context means faith.

verses.text: 耶穌基督昨天、今天、一直到永遠都是一樣的。
你們不要被各樣怪異的教訓勾引去了。人心靠著恩典，而不是靠著食物得到堅定，才是好的；因為那些拘守食物的人，從來沒有得過益處。

words.note: Indicates a passive voice structure.
Often carries a negative connotation.
Used as a directional/resultative complement.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
In this compound, 典 contributes to the meaning of 'favor'.
Indicates a condition must be met first.
Implies strict, sometimes rigid, adherence.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun clause.
Always used with a negative, meaning 'never'.

verses.text: 我們有一座祭壇，壇上的祭物，是那些在會幕中供職的人沒有權利吃的。

words.note: Used for mountains, buildings, altars, etc.
Refers to the portable sanctuary used by Israelites.
Often follows another noun to indicate 'inside'.
Formal term for holding a position or performing duties.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun clause.

verses.text: 那些祭牲的血，由大祭司帶進聖所作贖罪祭，祭牲的身體卻要在營外焚燒。

words.note: Refers to the specific office/role of the high priest.
Auxiliary verb indicating obligation or strong intention.

verses.text: 所以耶穌也是這樣在城門外受苦，為的是要藉著自己的血使人民成聖。
那麼，讓我們也出到營外到他那裡去，擔當他的凌辱。
因為在這裡我們沒有長存的城，我們卻是尋求那將要來的城。

words.definition: do not have, there is no

verses.text: 所以，我們要藉著耶穌，常常把頌讚的祭品獻給 神，這就是承認他的名的人嘴唇的果子。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, preceding the verb.
Empty space for reverence, especially before '神' (God).
Connects a noun phrase (承認他的名的人) to the main clause.

verses.text: 你們也不要忘記行善和捐輸，這樣的祭是 神所喜悅的。

words.note: A full-width space used before names like 'God' in some Bibles for reverence.

verses.text: 你們要聽從那些領導你們的人，也要順服他們；因為他們為你們的靈魂警醒，好像要交帳的人一樣。你們要使他們交帳的時候快快樂樂，不至於歎息；如果他們歎息，對你們就沒有好處了。

words.definition: not so as to, not result in

verses.text: 請為我們禱告，因為我們深信自己良心無虧，願意凡事遵行正道。
我更加要求你們為我們禱告，好使我們能夠快點回到你們那裡去。
願賜平安的 神，就是那憑著永約的血，把群羊的大牧人我們的主耶穌，從死人中領出來的那一位，

words.note: A full-width space used before names like 'God' in some Bibles for reverence.

verses.heading: Benediction and Conclusion

verses.text: 在一切善事上成全你們，好使你們遵行他的旨意；又藉著耶穌基督在我們裡面，行他所喜悅的事。願榮耀歸給他，直到永永遠遠。阿們。

words.note: Indicates scope or aspect.
Introduces the object of a verb or forms a nominal phrase.

words.definition: to ascribe to, to be given to

words.note: Reduplication for emphasis, meaning 'eternally'.

verses.text: 弟兄們，我勸你們耐心接受我這勸勉的話，因為我只是簡略地寫給你們。
你們要知道，我們的弟兄提摩太已經釋放了；如果他來得早，我就跟他一起去看你們。

words.note: Connects verb to a complement describing the manner or result.

verses.text: 請問候所有領導你們的人和所有聖徒。從意大利來的人也問候你們。
願恩惠與你們眾人同在。

words.definition: to be with, to abide with
